message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.HC, cs.AI, cs.LG. 

The paper describes a system for detecting human-machine interactions using a monocular camera, which is a common approach in robotics (cs.RO). The system uses computer vision techniques to predict poses of humans and robots from a single image (cs.CV). The goal of the system is to coordinate human-machine interactions, which falls under the category of human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The system also uses predefined virtual sensors, which suggests the use of artificial intelligence techniques (cs.AI). Finally, the system merges pose information to a metric 3D space, which could involve machine learning algorithms for regression or classification (cs.LG).
